meanings.definition: To move or carry (something) with great effort or difficulty.
meanings.sent1: She was shauling the heavy boxes up the stairs.
meanings.sent2: The workers were shauling the furniture across the room.
meanings.sent3: He tried shauling the giant pumpkin, but it rolled away!
meanings.sent4: The ants were shauling the food back to their nest with impressive teamwork.
meanings.sent5: The image of her shauling the boulder uphill stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: The act of moving or carrying something with great effort or difficulty.
meanings.sent1: The shauling of the piano down the narrow hallway was exhausting.
meanings.sent2: We could hear the shauling of the heavy equipment from a distance.
meanings.sent3: The shauling of the oversized teddy bear made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The shauling of emotions in her eyes was evident to all who looked.
meanings.sent5: The shauling of the ancient statue revealed its true weight and value.
